docs.snippet: Imports from the United States by Uruguay will depend in great measure upon the success Uruguay has in marketing its wool in this country, John P. Hoover, first secretary of the United States Embassy at Montevideo said yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Imports from the United States by Uruguay will depend in great measure upon the success Uruguay has in marketing its wool in this country, John P. Hoover, first secretary of the United States Embassy at Montevideo said yesterday.
docs.abstract: US Embassy (Montevideo) sec J P Hoover notes strong currency; sees possible dollar shortage

headline.main: WOOL CALLED KEY TO URUGUAY TRADE; Her Imports From U. S. Will Depend on Sales Here, Aide at Our Embassy Says

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 -- The State Department acted today to smooth over a Uruguayan grievance.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 -- The State Department acted today to smooth over a Uruguayan grievance.
docs.abstract: State Dept acts to settle dispute with Uruguay over Army purchases; misunderstanding over contract with Argentine co blamed

headline.main: U. S., URUGUAY SETTLE GRIEVANCE OVER MEAT

headline.main: EDUCATORS MEET IN CUBA; Inter-American Research Group Opens Two-Day Session

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: There was a listless air about the foreign exchange market last week as it slid off that lull which always follows a feverish movement, and pound sterling was the one unit which had provided that element up to a fortnight ago when opinion veered to...
docs.lead_paragraph: There was a listless air about the foreign exchange market last week as it slid off that lull which always follows a feverish movement, and pound sterling was the one unit which had provided that element up to a fortnight ago when opinion veered to waiting out the IMF meeting next month for a settlement of the question -- devaluation or no. The result, business was small in all sections.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Aug. 5, 1949.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, Aug. 9 -- A special committee of the United Nations General Assembly today approved Secretary General Trygye Lie's recommendation that each annual session of the Assembly be opened with a minute of silence for prayer or meditation.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, Aug. 9 -- A special committee of the United Nations General Assembly today approved Secretary General Trygye Lie's recommendation that each annual session of the Assembly be opened with a minute of silence for prayer or meditation.
docs.abstract: UN Assembly com approves min of silence for prayer or meditation at sessions

headline.main: U. N. GROUP VOTES MINUTE OF SILENCE; Time for Prayer or Meditation at Assembly Openings Is Approved, 6 to 0

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: QUITO, Ecuador, Aug. 11 (UP) -- Sister American Republics, led by the United States, sent a swelling stream of mercy planes to this earthquake-devastated country today.
docs.lead_paragraph: QUITO, Ecuador, Aug. 11 (UP) -- Sister American Republics, led by the United States, sent a swelling stream of mercy planes to this earthquake-devastated country today.

headline.main: 17 PLANES HASTEN ECUADOR QUAKE AID; U. S. Leads Sister Republics With Food, Medicines, Tents -- Steady Flow Continues

docs.snippet: A suggestion that a Western Hemisphere Import-Export Conference be held to wrestle with the growing problem of the dollar famine among Latin-American countries has been suggested in Uruguay and is under discussion by foreign trade groups here, it was...
docs.lead_paragraph: A suggestion that a Western Hemisphere Import-Export Conference be held to wrestle with the growing problem of the dollar famine among Latin-American countries has been suggested in Uruguay and is under discussion by foreign trade groups here, it was learned yesterday.

headline.main: TALKS ON SHORTAGE OF DOLLAR STUDIED; Western Hemisphere Parley to Seek Solution to Problem Weighed by Trade Groups

docs.snippet: An erratic movement in the pound sterling on Friday in which the demand for spot carried to the best price of the week, while forwards widened to sharp discounts, featured an otherwise stagnant market in the foreign exchanges.
docs.lead_paragraph: An erratic movement in the pound sterling on Friday in which the demand for spot carried to the best price of the week, while forwards widened to sharp discounts, featured an otherwise stagnant market in the foreign exchanges.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Aug. 12, 1949.
